title: 111_hr5739
content: CHAPTER 1404--AMERICAN MILITARY RETIREES ASSOCIATION: Grant of Federal Charter to American Military Retirees Association in Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The American Military Retirees Association is a federally chartered nonprofit organization that must comply with specific provisions to maintain its charter. The organization is organized under the laws of the State of New York and meets the requirements for a veterans service organization. The American Military Retirees Association is a federally chartered nonprofit organization with purposes including educating on benefits and advocating for protection of earned benefits. Membership eligibility and governing body details are outlined in the organization's bylaws and articles of incorporation. The corporation's officers and their election process are determined by the articles of incorporation and bylaws. The corporation's powers are limited to what is specified in its bylaws and articles of incorporation. Restrictions include not issuing stock or paying dividends, and prohibiting the distribution of income or assets to directors, officers, or members during the charter's duration. Compensation for officers and employees is allowed. The corporation is restricted from making loans to directors, officers, employees, or members. It cannot claim congressional approval or authority from the US government. It must maintain its status as a corporation under Virginia law. Failure to maintain tax-exempt status will result in charter termination. The corporation must keep accurate financial records. The corporation must maintain correct and complete records of account, minutes of proceedings, and a record of member names and addresses. Members can inspect records for any proper purpose. The corporation must comply with state laws on service of process and is liable for acts of officers and agents. The corporation is liable for acts of officers and agents within its authority. It must submit an annual report to Congress on its activities. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia and U.S. territories. The American Military Retirees Association is identified as "1404. American Military Retirees Association..... 140401".
